Then, this week in MMA history the original Double Champ, Conor McGregor made history at Madison Square Garden becoming the 1st fighter to hold titles in two divisions simultaneously. articles.title: Alex Pereira vs Chimaev !!
articles.description: Don‚Äôt miss out on all the action this week at DraftKings! Download the DraftKings app today! Sign-up using https://dkng.co/sonnen or through my promo code SONNEN Alex Pereira just shook the combat sports world. In a move only Chael Sonnen could break down, Pereira publicly called out Khamzat Chimaev for a grappling match‚Äîleaving fans buzzing about what might happen next. But there‚Äôs more to this story than just a challenge; it‚Äôs about strategy, legacy, and willingness to fight. Chael explains the nuance behind this bold call-out. Pereira, already one of the top fighters of his era, has consistently shown willingness to step up, even when the stakes are high. Khamzat Chimaev, meanwhile, has his own ambitions and is focused on bigger matchups, leaving Pereira‚Äôs challenge in an interesting trap: will Chimaev accept, ignore, or refuse? Chael uses examples from past matchups‚Äîlike Ilia Taporia vs. Islam Makhachev‚Äîto show how willingness alone shapes legacy, regardless of who actually wins inside the cage. This isn‚Äôt just hype‚ÄîChael emphasizes how these decisions impact rankings, fan perception, and the ‚Äúgreatest of all time‚Äù conversation. Even if a grappling match never happens, Pereira‚Äôs move forces Khamzat to respond, and it keeps Pereira in the spotlight as a fearless competitor unafraid to make bold plays. Watch as Chael Sonnen breaks down Pereira‚Äôs strategy, explains the potential outcomes, and teases the next chapter in this high-stakes chess game between two elite fighters. articles.title: Rogan vs Ronda: Chael Says the Quiet Part Out Loud
articles.description: Don‚Äôt miss out on all the action this week at DraftKings! Download the DraftKings app today! Sign-up using https://dkng.co/sonnen or through my promo code SONNEN Rogan vs. Ronda ‚Äî Chael Sonnen breaks down the real story. In this clip, Chael explains why Joe Rogan‚Äôs comments about Ronda Rousey weren‚Äôt personal, weren‚Äôt disrespectful, and absolutely weren‚Äôt wrong. Rogan was simply following the one golden rule he once gave Chael: ‚ÄúSay what you see.‚Äù Chael dives into how the tension between Rogan and Ronda started, why her feelings were hurt, and why that reaction shows a bigger disconnect ‚Äî not just about her career, but about the entire history of women‚Äôs MMA. Chael lays out why it‚Äôs important to tell Ronda‚Äôs story accurately: to celebrate what she did without erasing the greatness of Amanda Nunes, Cris Cyborg, Valentina Shevchenko, Kayla Harrison, Julianna Pe√±a, Rose Namajunas, and the women who came after her. He also explains the trap of calling anyone ‚Äúthe greatest of all time‚Äù without context. Just like with Michael Jordan talk, Chael argues it unintentionally disrespects every athlete who elevated the sport afterward. Ronda wasn‚Äôt wrong for being proud ‚Äî but the myth around her has to be corrected so the sport keeps moving forward. Chael ends by addressing Ronda‚Äôs claim that Rogan ‚Äúisn‚Äôt an expert.‚Äù He shuts that down immediately. No one besides Dana White has seen more fights, called more fights, or spent more time studying MMA than Joe Rogan. Experience matters ‚Äî and Rogan is an expert whether he fought professionally or not. Watch the full breakdown to hear Chael explain the nuances, the history, and why setting the record straight matters. #MMA #ChaelSonnen #RondaRousey #JoeRogan #UFCHistory #WMMA #UFC Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Islam Won‚Äôt Go Back Down to 155 #ufc
articles.description: If Islam Makhachev beats Jack Hermansson and becomes the 170-pound UFC champion, Chael Sonnen says one thing‚Äôs for sure ‚Äî Islam is never going back to lightweight. Once a fighter tastes success at a higher weight class, history shows they don‚Äôt go back down. And Chael‚Äôs seen it all. In this clip, Chael breaks down why cutting back to 155 would make no sense for Islam. The benefits of staying at welterweight go beyond performance ‚Äî it‚Äôs about quality of life, training happiness, and longevity in the fight game. As Chael puts it, Islam doesn‚Äôt even realize yet how much better life feels when you‚Äôre not killing yourself to make weight. Chael‚Äôs take isn‚Äôt just opinion ‚Äî it‚Äôs perspective from a fighter who‚Äôs been there. articles.title: Islam vs Ilia? Do It at 170. #ufc
articles.description: Chael Sonnen says it straight: Khabib‚Äôs wrong on this one. When it comes to Islam Makhachev vs. Ilia Topuria, everyone‚Äôs asking the wrong question ‚Äî it‚Äôs not if they fight, it‚Äôs where. The debate over whether Ilia should drop to 155 misses the whole point. Chael lays it out clearly: if they do this fight at 170 pounds, you open the door to something historic ‚Äî the chance for Ilia Topuria to become the first-ever three-division champion. That‚Äôs the story. That‚Äôs the headline. But Team Khabib, according to Chael, is too focused on protecting Islam instead of chasing legacy. This is classic Chael analysis ‚Äî bold, strategic, and grounded in the real fight business. Forget what‚Äôs ‚Äúbest for your guy.‚Äù The right move is what gets the fight, what grows the brand, what captures history. Islam vs. Ilia at 170 isn‚Äôt just a matchup ‚Äî it‚Äôs an event that changes divisions, rankings, and pay-per-views overnight. üëâ Watch more of Chael‚Äôs unfiltered takes and stay ahead of MMA‚Äôs power moves.

articles.title: Striker vs Grappler: The Game Has Changed #ufc
articles.description: The old rule said grapplers always win. But that rule‚Äôs starting to crack ‚Äî and in this clip, Chael Sonnen breaks down why. From Jose Aldo and Israel Adesanya to Alex Pereira, the script has flipped. The striker-versus-grappler battle isn‚Äôt what it used to be, and history‚Äôs starting to argue back. Chael dives into the upcoming matchup between Islam Makhachev and Jack Hermansson, dissecting why this fight isn‚Äôt as predictable as people think. Jack didn‚Äôt chase this fight ‚Äî he was forced into it. Meanwhile, Islam chose to move up for this exact opponent. That alone tells you something. It tells Chael everything. This isn‚Äôt just about styles ‚Äî it‚Äôs about strategy, psychology, and what fighters know behind the scenes. When Chael says, ‚Äúthese guys already know who‚Äôs going to win,‚Äù you better believe there‚Äôs meaning behind it. And when he mentions ‚Äúthe curse,‚Äù you know he‚Äôs about to stir the pot.
